intro: Niphobolus lingulatus, commonly known as the slender false hellebore, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America, typically found in moist, woodlands. The plant features dark green, elongated leaves with a waxy texture and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are red and toxic, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals. Niphobolus lingulatus plays a role in local ecosystems but is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habits.
